issue.title: disqus.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://disqus.com/home](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdisqus.com%2Fhome) ### Comment > Disqus recently changed some things, which now breaks external links to sites when the AdGuard Tracking Protection Filter is in use. The filter causing the issue is: `disqus.com#%#//scriptlet('href-sanitizer', 'a[href*="://disq.us/url?url="]', 'text')` > > Disqus now replaces the text content of the node for long URLs with a truncation of the URL followed by "...". This means the filter now replaces the original disq.us tracking URL with this truncated text, which isn't a valid URL, so the link becomes broken. > > uBlock Origin's privacy filterlist, by contrast works correctly as it grabs from either the title attribute or percent-decodes the target URL from the href attribute, wherever contains the URL: > > https://github.com/uBlockOrigin/uAssets/blob/master/filters/privacy.txt > > `! https://github.com/uBlockOrigin/uAssets/issues/20066 > disqus.com##+js(href-sanitizer, a[href^="https://disq.us/url?url="][title^="http"], [title]) > disqus.com##+js(href-sanitizer, a[href^="https://disq.us/?url=http"], ?url) > disqus.com##a[href][data-link-out]:remove-attr(data-link-out)` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/gkleewiteu8gc084scgw4kgswgckk04p7oi11wps7k.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/tnv0f46yydc048c4g0cco0og8cgwsgceamhghu995w.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- Platform: | uBlock Origin v1.66.0 System version: | `Windows 11, version 22H2` Browser: | Firefox Filters: | Ad blocking:

EasyList

comment.body:
Не повторяется.
Попробуйте очистить данные браузера, обновить фильтры (подождите около одной минуты), затем откройте сайт.
Если это не поможет, вам следует повторно включить блокировщики контента (веб расширения) в настройках Safari (подождите примерно столько же времени, сколько и при обновлении фильтров).

comment.body:
Не повторяется.
Попробуйте оставить только фильтры AdGuard из списка ниже, очистить данные браузера, обновить фильтры (подождите около одной минуты), затем откройте сайт.
Если это не поможет, вам следует повторно включить блокировщики контента (веб расширения) в настройках Safari (подождите примерно столько же времени, сколько и при обновлении фильтров).

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: Reporting a large list of suspicious browser fingerprinting scripts
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Hello. I have a system that crawls top domains and collects browser API usage data. Building on prior research that measures entropy exposed by browser APIs, the system estimates the entropy gathered by each script. Using this approach, I got an extensive list of scripts that are suspicious for browser fingerprinting, like scripts I reported `https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues?q=is%3Aissue%20author%3Ajsu6`. I wonder if there is any way I can contribute this list to AdgraudTeam without reporting them individually? I am glad to answer any questions related to it. 

Also, for the scripts I reported `https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues?q=is%3Aissue%20author%3Ajsu6`, I saw some of them are still open. Is there any reason why they are still open rather than closed as false positives or resolved?

### Proposed solution

NA

### Additional information

_No response_

comment.body: I think manual checking is necessary, because not all users will realize that the cause of the malfunction is the ad blocker.

Not reproduced on my end.
Try to update the filters (wait almost one minute there), clear browser data, restart it, open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

### Issue URL (Ads) [https://member.streffy.com/base/v2/Advertisement/GetDisplayAdvertisements](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmember.streffy.com%2Fbase%2Fv2%2FAdvertisement%2FGetDisplayAdvertisements) ### Comment > 微信小程序 "如意馄饨" 出现的弹窗广告(如图)，关闭按钮很难点击。 > > 此广告的数据通过 `https://member.streffy.com/base/v2/Advertisement/GetDisplayAdvertisements` 获取，后面不带任何请求参数，返回类型为json > > 而且不能通过简单的hosts屏蔽，因为此HOST也用于请求用户信息，完全屏蔽将导致无法登录 > > 返回类型必须为空json `{}`，否则整个小程序会卡死 > > 拦截规则: `||member.streffy.com/base/v2/Advertisement/GetDisplayAdvertisements$redirect=noopjson` > > (抱歉不能直接截屏，因为可能有隐水印追踪用户信息) ``` Username: @wujinjun-MC ``` ### Screenshots

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://member.streffy.com/base/v2/Advertisement/GetDisplayAdvertisements](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmember.streffy.com%2Fbase%2Fv2%2FAdvertisement%2FGetDisplayAdvertisements) ### Comment > 微信小程序 "如意馄饨" 出现的弹窗广告(如图)，关闭按钮很难点击。 > > 此广告的数据通过 `https://member.streffy.com/base/v2/Advertisement/GetDisplayAdvertisements` 获取，后面不带任何请求参数，返回类型为json > > 而且不能通过简单的hosts屏蔽，因为此HOST也用于请求用户信息，完全屏蔽将导致无法登录 > > 返回类型必须为空json `{}`，否则整个小程序会卡死 > > 拦截规则: `||member.streffy.com/base/v2/Advertisement/GetDisplayAdvertisements$redirect=noopjson` > > (抱歉不能直接截屏，因为可能有隐水印追踪用户信息) ``` Username: @wujinjun-MC ``` ### Screenshots

comment.body:
Update rule: `||member.streffy.com/base/v2/Advertisement/GetDisplayAdvertisements$jsonprune=\$.advertisements[?(has advertisementId)]`

This will remove all items in `advertisements` array but not remove `advertisements` itself. Now the mini-program will not repeat retrying.

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://member.streffy.com/base/v2/Advertisement/GetDisplayAdvertisements](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmember.streffy.com%2Fbase%2Fv2%2FAdvertisement%2FGetDisplayAdvertisements) ### Comment > 微信小程序 "如意馄饨" 出现的弹窗广告(如图)，关闭按钮很难点击。 > > 此广告的数据通过 `https://member.streffy.com/base/v2/Advertisement/GetDisplayAdvertisements` 获取，后面不带任何请求参数，返回类型为json > > 而且不能通过简单的hosts屏蔽，因为此HOST也用于请求用户信息，完全屏蔽将导致无法登录 > > 返回类型必须为空json `{}`，否则整个小程序会卡死 > > 拦截规则: `||member.streffy.com/base/v2/Advertisement/GetDisplayAdvertisements$redirect=noopjson` > > (抱歉不能直接截屏，因为可能有隐水印追踪用户信息) ``` Username: @wujinjun-MC ``` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/nsp1cdknr808k8gs8o4400ocgcwok4kktv0o0iuof4.jpg?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for Android v4.11 System version: | `Android 14` Browser: | 微信小程序 License type: | free AdGuard mode: | VPN HTTPS filtering: | enabled Android system root: | true Tracking protection: | disabled DNS filtering: | disabled Filters: | Ad blocking:
AdGuard Base,
AdGuard Mobile Ads

Privacy:
AdGuard URL Tracking,
AdGuard Tracking Protection

Language-specific:
EasyList China Browsing Security: | disabled Browsing Security statistics: | disabled Userscripts: | disabled

comment.body:
> @wujinjun-MC Hi. Could you please provide a download link?

"如意馄饨" is a mini-program in WeChat(Chinese Edition). You can download it at https://weixin.qq.com/

> No problems or side effects, when that request is blocked?

Sometimes white screen (retry loop). I think `$jsonprune` may help.

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://www.golem.de/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.golem.de%2F) ### Comment > golem.de was recently updated with what seem to be inline scripts or classes that update somehow to circumvent ad blocking. I have tried to specifically remove the ad parts and create individual rules, but this only works in the current session. As soon as the page is reloaded it goes back to ad-mania. Maybe relevant, the main page content loads quickly, then the ads take several more seconds to load into the available whitespace. Sometimes even the whitespace is not present yet in the first second after loading the page. But it all comes back within the first 10s. ``` Username: @matthisd ``` ### Screenshots

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

I have tried to specifically remove the ad parts and create individual rules, but this only works in the current session. As soon as the page is reloaded it goes back to ad-mania. Maybe relevant, the main page content loads quickly, then the ads take several more seconds to load into the available whitespace. issue.title: Reporting a large list of suspicious browser fingerprinting scripts
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Hello. I have a system that crawls top domains and collects browser API usage data. Building on prior research that measures entropy exposed by browser APIs, the system estimates the entropy gathered by each script. Using this approach, I got an extensive list of scripts that are suspicious for browser fingerprinting, like scripts I reported `https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues?q=is%3Aissue%20author%3Ajsu6`. I wonder if there is any way I can contribute this list to AdgraudTeam without reporting them individually? I am glad to answer any questions related to it. 

Also, for the scripts I reported `https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues?q=is%3Aissue%20author%3Ajsu6`, I saw some of them are still open. Is there any reason why they are still open rather than closed as false positives or resolved?

### Proposed solution

NA

### Additional information

_No response_

comment.body:
I agree that manual checking is necessary. I envision my system as a tool that identifies missed fingerprinting and tracking scripts through automated crawling. It can also perform pre-checks to handle the necessary verifications before a new rule is added to blocklists. This would alleviate the workload for maintainers who would still perform the final review.

I understand the reasons why it may not fit the specific goals you want to achieve, and I am totally fine with it not being deployed into production. I just want to speed up the reporting process for a large number of suspicious scripts. I hope we can agree on a process that avoids the need for me to check and report them one by one and for maintainers to confirm them one by one, thereby saving everyone's time.

issue.title: Reporting a large list of suspicious browser fingerprinting scripts
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Hello. I have a system that crawls top domains and collects browser API usage data. Building on prior research that measures entropy exposed by browser APIs, the system estimates the entropy gathered by each script. Using this approach, I got an extensive list of scripts that are suspicious for browser fingerprinting, like scripts I reported `https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues?q=is%3Aissue%20author%3Ajsu6`. I wonder if there is any way I can contribute this list to AdgraudTeam without reporting them individually? I am glad to answer any questions related to it. 

Also, for the scripts I reported `https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues?q=is%3Aissue%20author%3Ajsu6`, I saw some of them are still open. Is there any reason why they are still open rather than closed as false positives or resolved?

### Proposed solution

NA

### Additional information

_No response_

comment.body:
I agree that manual checking is necessary. I envision my system as a tool that identifies missed fingerprinting and tracking scripts through automated crawling. It can also perform pre-checks to handle the necessary verifications before a new rule is added to blocklists. This would alleviate the workload for maintainers who would still perform the final review.

I understand the reasons why it may not fit the specific goals you want to achieve, and I am totally fine with it not being deployed into production. I just want to speed up the reporting process for a large number of suspicious scripts. I hope we can agree on a process that avoids the need for me to check and report them one by one and for maintainers to confirm them one by one, thereby saving everyone's time.

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

comment.body: Can't reproduce the last two. Please test with updated filters.

issue.title: Reporting a large list of suspicious browser fingerprinting scripts
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Hello. I have a system that crawls top domains and collects browser API usage data. Building on prior research that measures entropy exposed by browser APIs, the system estimates the entropy gathered by each script. Using this approach, I got an extensive list of scripts that are suspicious for browser fingerprinting, like scripts I reported `https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues?q=is%3Aissue%20author%3Ajsu6`. I wonder if there is any way I can contribute this list to AdgraudTeam without reporting them individually? I am glad to answer any questions related to it. 

Also, for the scripts I reported `https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues?q=is%3Aissue%20author%3Ajsu6`, I saw some of them are still open. Is there any reason why they are still open rather than closed as false positives or resolved?

### Proposed solution

NA

### Additional information

_No response_

comment.body:
I agree that manual checking is necessary. I envision my system as a tool that identifies missed fingerprinting and tracking scripts through automated crawling. It can also perform pre-checks to handle the necessary verifications before a new rule is added to blocklists. This would alleviate the workload for maintainers who would still perform the final review.

I understand the reasons why it may not fit the specific goals you want to achieve, and I am totally fine with it not being deployed into production. I just want to speed up the reporting process for a large number of suspicious scripts. I hope we can agree on a process that avoids the need for me to check and report them one by one and for maintainers to confirm them one by one, thereby saving everyone's time.

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

comment.body: Can't reproduce the last two. Please test with updated filters.

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://www.golem.de/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.golem.de%2F) ### Comment > golem.de was recently updated with what seem to be inline scripts or classes that update somehow to circumvent ad blocking. I have tried to specifically remove the ad parts and create individual rules, but this only works in the current session. As soon as the page is reloaded it goes back to ad-mania. Maybe relevant, the main page content loads quickly, then the ads take several more seconds to load into the available whitespace. Sometimes even the whitespace is not present yet in the first second after loading the page. But it all comes back within the first 10s. ``` Username: @matthisd ``` ### Screenshots
